intro: Colymbada spruneri, commonly known as the sand sedge, is a flowering plant native to sandy and coastal environments in southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous white or greenish flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds. Colymbada spruneri plays a role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
